docs.text: retelling the classic story of joan of arc has been a popular trend this year .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: earlier this may , leelee sobieski played the passionate title role in the top-rated miniseries that debuted on cbs .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and now , director luc besson has delivered his version of the sweeping epic about the teenage girl supposedly sent by god to rescue france from the clutches of their enemies .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: starring milla jovovich , who is predominantly unconvincing as the heavenly messenger accused of being a witch , `the messenger : the story of joan of arc' is a disjointed and overblown historical re-enactment that prevails merely as a bloated mistreatment of the famous legend .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: besson ( who's previous work includes the hyperactive sci-fi `the fifth element' ) perhaps entrusted a bit too much faith in ex-wife jovovich , because in `the messenger' , the actress is drowning in a pool of her own inexperience .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: at first , when reports were indicating that jovovich had been chosen for such a demanding role , i was highly doubtful that her marginal talent could carry a film of such a caliber .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: after seeing the rousing trailer , my hesitant optimism suddenly skyrocketed - milla jovovich looked superb .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: with the hopeful propulsion of her stellar performance , `the messenger' looked like a timeless epic in the making .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: a timeless epic it is not .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: besson is hesitant to abandon his unique and flashy style , and the story behind `the messenger' is not entirely suited to his demands .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: on the shoulders of besson's choppy and unexciting direction , the film dissipates into an uninspiring hodgepodge of poorly executed battle sequences and bizarre imagery .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: there is no human exploration into the character of joan ( or jeanne ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: jovovich merely rambles on about the power of god when we have little or no insight into her visionary objective .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: jovivich's unsatisfying portrayal only helps lead to the realization that besson sees jeanne as a piece of spiritual cardboard .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: she is just another special effect in this continuous visual feast .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: jovovich does have a few isolated moments of sheer power , but mainly , she looks lost .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: quite frankly , i don't know of any actress who could successfully navigate her way through `the messenger' without a major fumble .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the script is chock-full of laughable dialogue and unfortunate comedy , as jeanne confronts the uncrowned king charles vii ( john malkovich ) and informs him of her heavenly intentions .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: faye dunaway plays charles' overbearing mother-in-law , and dustin hoffman appears over two-hours into the story as a character dubbed ? the conscience' .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: all three actors juggle limited screen time , although malkovich is uncharacteristically awful .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the battle scenes are extremely bloody , but with the presence of such jittery camera work , they capture none of the excitement or finesse of something like `braveheart' .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: there's a particularly graphic and unsettling scene early on , when jeanne ( as a young girl ) watches in horror from a closet as her older sister is murdered and then savagely raped by a bloodthirsty english soldier .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: even his fellow troopers are petrified .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: `the messenger' is also strictly a 90's update on the classic story .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: almost too 90's , it seems .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: there's gratuitous use of the f-word and a barrage of slang terms like `she's nuts ! '
docs.label: negative

docs.text: sprinkled throughout the screenplay .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i was half-expecting jeanne to invite her homeys to come chill in her crib , but it never happened .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: there's also the familiar presence of bizarre besson humor , but none of it comes even remotely close to functioning properly .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it seems terribly misplaced , but in a catastrophe as jumbled and disjointed as `the messenger' , almost everything does .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the musical score by erric serra is spectacular , and the set and production designs are continuously impressive .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: if it was visual excellence that besson was striving for , then he achieves his goal .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but the only time the dramatics come alive in `the messenger' is during the closing trial , in which jeanne is found guilty and burned at the stake .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: during these moments , the historical relevance and dramatic purpose of joan of arc reaches the audience , albeit in a faint stream of light that provokes little power or meaning .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it's just too delayed for besson to revive his lifeless interpretation , in which he is always concerned with the wrong aspects .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: `the messenger : the story of joan of arc' is an unlikely and unwelcome historical addition to the hollywood shelf .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: anyone searching for an entertaining epic is going to be painfully slapped with an overblown and confusing film .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: despite my original hopefulness , milla jovovich is not going to have to worry about thanking the academy .
docs.label: negative
